title: HP 3COM/H3C Intelligent Management Center imcsyslogdm Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of HP 3com/H3C Intelligent Management Center. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The flaw exists within the imcsyslogdm.exe component which listens by default on UDP port 514. When handling a syslog packet having a size larger than 2048 bytes the process attempts to exit. An exception handler is called that makes a call into a location that has been previously freed. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code under the context of the SYSTEM user.
addtionnal_details: Hewlett-Packard has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c02822750
timeline:
